Dataset_Info.Funding_Info: NOAA Climate Program Office; NOAA Ocean Acidification Program

Variable.Description_of_Variable: Mole fraction of CO2 in the equilibrator headspace (dry) at equilibrator temperature (ppm)
Mole fraction of CO2 measured in dry outside air (ppm)
Mole fraction of CO2 in outside air associated with each water analysis. These values are interpolated between the bracketing averaged good xCO2_ATM analyses (ppm)
Barometric pressure in the equilibrator headspace (hPa)
Barometric pressure measured outside, corrected to sea level (hPa)
Sea surface salinity on Practical Salinity Scale (o/oo)
Fugacity of CO2 in sea water at SST and 100% humidity (μatm)
Fugacity of CO2 in air corresponding to the interpolated xCO2 at SST and 100% humidity (μatm)
Sea water fCO2 minus interpolated air fCO2 (μatm)
Quality control flag for fCO2 values (2=good, 3=questionable)
Quality control subflag for fCO2 values, provides explanation when QC flag=3

Equilibrator_Design.Location_of_Sea_Water_Intake: Through the bottom of the hull, three decks below Wet Laboratory
Equilibrator_Design.Equilibrator_Type: Spray head above dynamic pool with thermal jacket
Equilibrator_Design.Drying_Method_for_CO2_in_water: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry).
Equilibrator_Design.Additional_Information: Primary equilibrator is vented through a secondary equilibrator.

CO2_in_Marine_Air.Measurement: Yes, 5 readings in a group every 3.5 hours
CO2_in_Marine_Air.Location_and_Height: Inlet on radar mast, 34m above sea surface
CO2_in_Marine_Air.Drying_Method: Gas stream passes through a thermoelectric condenser (~5 °C) and then through a Perma Pure (Nafion) dryer before reaching the analyzer (90% dry).

CO2_Sensor.Manufacturer_of_Calibration_Gas: Std 1: CB10923, 305.52 ppm, owned by ESRL, used every ~5.0 hours. Std 2: CC114995, 376.31 ppm, owned by ESRL, used every ~5.0 hours. Std 3: CA04480, 420.54 ppm, owned by ESRL, used every ~5.0 hours. Std 4: CB11297, 504.52 ppm, owned by ESRL, used every ~5.0 hours. Std 5: LL100000, 0.00 ppm, owned by AOML, used every ~5.0 hours.
CO2_Sensor.CO2_Sensor_Calibration: The analyzer is calibrated every 5 hours with field standards that in turn were calibrated with primary standards that are directly traceable to the WMO X2019 scale. Standards on the X2007 scale will be specified if used. The zero gas is ultra-high purity air.
CO2_Sensor.Other_Comments: The instrument is located in the Wet Laboratory on the starboard side of Deck 3, ~4m above the water line. The temperature in the space is regulated. Ultra-High Purity air (0.0 ppm CO2) and the high standard gas are used to zero and span the LI-COR analyzer.
CO2_Sensor.Method_References: Pierrot, D., C. Neil, K. Sullivan, R. Castle, R. Wanninkhof, H. Lueger, T. Johannessen, A. Olsen, R. A. Feely, and C. E. Cosca (2009), Recommendations for autonomous underway pCO2 measuring systems and data reduction routines, Deep-Sea Res II, 56, 512-522.

Sea_Surface_Temperature.Location: In scientific sensor and pump room, before the SW pump and about 3m after the intake, which is directly through the ship's hull.
Sea_Surface_Temperature.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; Maintained by the ship.

Equilibrator_Temperature.Location: Inserted into equilibrator ~5 cm below water level

Equilibrator_Pressure.Location: Attached to equilibrator headspace. Differential pressure reading from Setra 239 attached to the equilibrator headspace is added to the pressure reading from the internal LICOR pressure sensor.
Equilibrator_Pressure.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision.

Atmospheric_Pressure.Location: Attached to EUCA Weather Station on deck 10, 26 m above sea level
Atmospheric_Pressure.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; Maintained by ship.

Sea_Surface_Salinity.Location: Near the pCO2 System in the Wet Laboratory
Sea_Surface_Salinity.Other_Comments: Manufacturer's Resolution is taken as Precision; Maintained by ship.

x_tags.Additional_Information: The analytical system operated well during this cruise. The seawater pump was not run while the ship was among ice. The LICOR pressure sensor showed a drift from normal operation. The LICOR pressure was estimated by subtracting 1.6 mbar from the sea surface atmospheric pressure. The offset between the LICOR and atmospheric pressures was measured during the first cruise, WFCH20220424. The XCO2 output of the LI-6262 was recalculated with the updated pressures before processing the pCO2 raw data. Original Data Location: http://www.aoml.noaa.gov/ocd/ocdweb/charcot/charcot_introduction.html Full unprocessed data files from analytical instrument including flow information and TSG data at time of sampling can be obtained upon request.
